main_definition: A marathon is a long-distance running race with an official distance of 42.195 kilometers (approximately 26.2 miles). It also refers to any prolonged endurance task or challenge that requires significant time, effort, and determination.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An athletic race of long-distance running
meanings_and_examples.example: The Boston Marathon is one of the oldest and most prestigious marathons in the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A prolonged endurance task or challenge
meanings_and_examples.example: Completing a personal development plan can be like running a mental marathon, requiring consistent effort over an extended period.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An unusually long event or undertaking in other contexts
meanings_and_examples.example: Managing the project took us two months to complete – it was quite the corporate marathon.
